DataElement.preferredName: Early Intervention Therapeutic Procedure Administered Therapeutic Procedure Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test)._A range of targeted services and supports that are available to babies and young children with developmental delays or specific health conditions._Medical care given to a patient to mitigate or cure an illness, injury, or reduced health status. NOTE: May include prescribed drugs, biologics, surgery, devices, and physical or psychotherapies, but not diagnostics or prophylaxis. See also intervention, diagnosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test)._A range of targeted services and supports that are available to babies and young children with developmental delays or specific health conditions.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A range of targeted services and supports that are available to babies and young children with developmental delays or specific health conditions.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A range of targeted services and supports that are available to babies and young children with developmental delays or specific health conditions.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Medical care given to a patient to mitigate or cure an illness, injury, or reduced health status. NOTE: May include prescribed drugs, biologics, surgery, devices, and physical or psychotherapies, but not diagnostics or prophylaxis. See also intervention, diagnosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A directive to indicate a response not listed.

Concepts.definition: A directive to indicate a response not listed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Interventions and exercises intended to develop, recover, or maintain the ability of an individual to accomplish their activities of daily living.

Concepts.definition: Interventions and exercises intended to develop, recover, or maintain the ability of an individual to accomplish their activities of daily living.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The treatment of deformity or disease through mechanical force and movement, including both active and passive exercises, intended to ameliorate injury, increase mobility, and improve overall function.

Concepts.definition: The treatment of deformity or disease through mechanical force and movement, including both active and passive exercises, intended to ameliorate injury, increase mobility, and improve overall function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
